hanzi-su-wiki:
年

Значения

Год, возраст

Мнемоника

  • Искажено. Элементы злак 禾 и тысяча 千 в значении «богатый урожай, которым завершается с/х год».

  • "Уйдёт целый год, прежде чем собрать урожай риса."

Варианты

秊

purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A man 干 carrying grain, representing the annual harvest
purpleculture_examples:
青年 [ qīng nián ]: youth; youthful years; young person; the young
今年 [ jīn nián ]: this year
去年 [ qù nián ]: last year
年代 [ nián dài ]: a decade of a century (e.g. the Sixties); age; era; period; Classifiers: 个
年轻 [ nián qīng ]: young
purpleculture_tree:

heisig_chinese_memo: A horse wearing sunglasses with one lens popped out after a particularly raucous celebration to ring in the New Year.
heisig_constituent: year, sign of the horse, sunglasses
heisig_story: In an odd fashion, the kanji for year joins together the element for horse, on the top, and the right half of the element for sunglasses. Think of it as a horse wearing sunglasses with one of the lenses popped out. We will use this latter image again, so learn it now and save yourself the trouble later.
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: год, счетчик в течение многих лет
koohiiStory1: A horse wears a pair of sunglasses with one lens popped out after a particularly raucous celebration to ring in the New Year.
koohiiStory2: A horse wears a monocle for New Years to appear dignified for the year of the horse. ――one lens = monocle, you will encounter this again in kanji like descend (#1308).

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The cow part of this kanji is slightly altered, but I think you can see where it is. The gun looks just fine, though. Think back to a fake memory you have living on the farm. You have your gun, and you gotta use it on a cow (ruh roh). Once a year on New Year's, you have to go out and shoot one of the cows. It's only a yearly shooting, though, so at least there's that respite.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You'll have to imagine yourself doing this to remember the meaning of the kanji. Focus on the thought that "okay... it's only once a year... I only have to do this once a year..."
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: It is New Years, though, so when you bring the dead cow back home, it’s time to celebrate. Using the cow’s organs and bones, you and your siblings construct a nendoroid (ねん). Nendoroids are Japanese toys - little plastic figurines (Google it if need be). You make a little cow nendoroid holding a gun. How cute.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: How funny that you use dead cow parts to make a miniature cow holding a gun much like the one you murdered earlier. Imagine yourself playing with this nendoroid as you think about how weird it was to make a cow nendoroid out of a dead cow.

humanum_full_description_en:
regular script now prevailing " in " word, from the shape of view, can be regarded as mere "word mark" (a reference Qiu Xigui). The pictograms and phonograms of its earlier glyphs have disappeared. "Kangxi Dictionary" classified the words into the " cadres " department, which seems to be a last resort.

The character of the year in oracle bone inscriptions bears the image of human beings, and the character is made of "秂". "人" is both the meaning and the pronunciation (see Wang Hui, Shen Pei; press: the same rhyme of "人" and "年" is still used in some Minnan dialects. Reserved). " Zi ", "Jade Chapter. "He Bu" instructs its meaning: "Want to knot rice", "Ji Yun. "True Rhyme" says: "He who desires to knot" means that he will be strong. The teaching of the two-character book coincides with the original meaning of the "秂" character. The crops can be harvested and tied into a bunch before people can bear the crops. Therefore, the original meaning of "秂" should be the ripe harvest. It can also refer to the harvest of crops in a year. This meaning is preserved in later terminology such as abundant years (the year of abundance is the year of the harvest), the year and the year. It is also possible that the grains are ripened every year, so they are used for time keeping.

After the Western Zhou Dynasty, the form of the gold characters was corrupted. The original " person " shape had a dot in the center, or horizontally drawn into a " thousand " shape, and the whole character was made into a "秊" shape. Its shape is inherited by Sleeping Tiger Dijian and Xiaozhuan. Some of the inscriptions add a picture under the " thousand " shape, and it becomes a " 𡈼 " shape (click: non-" non " shape, refer to " 𡈼 "). When talking about ancient characters, the horizontal painting is added, unintentionally: from Qian Nai to change from people, from 𡈼 Nai to change from Qiansuo (see Li Xiaoding). The Bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period have a copy of " earth " from the lower part of the font.

Xiao Zhuan from He Qiansheng. Wang Hui believes that thousands of characters originate from ten human voices, and Nian is the word for breast milk, so it can be homophonic with other people and can be prepared.

Mawangdui Han Mausoleum is written in silk characters like " hand " in later generations. In the regular script of the Eastern Wei Dynasty, there are the characters of the year from Heconggan (see Gao Zhan's epitaph). The character " Nian " in regular script that is currently popular has been seen in the Southern Dynasties (such as the Xiao Xu Monument).

Oracle uses its original meaning. The term "receiving the year" is often used in inscriptions, pronounced "grant year", which means to grant a good harvest (see Chen Bingxin).

It is also used as a noun of time period. In ancient times, Gu Yiming said one year, and the inscription: "Zhen from the present ten years 㞢 (also) five" ("Collection" 24610), the middle of the year is used for this meaning (Xu Zhongshu), which means fifteen years. If the analysis of this case is credible, then the "Er Ya" can be discussed, because the people of Yin probably already use " year " as a time record. "Erya·Shutian": "Xia is the year of the year, Shang is the sacred ceremony, and on Sunday, Tang Yu is the year of Zai." Don’t say whether the "Erya" is credible, Guo Pu’s note can still be found: "Sui, Take the stars and go once; for the sacrifice, take the four o'clock and one end; the year, take the crop for one ripe; load, take the thing and change the beginning." "Xing Bingshu": "The year is the name of the crop. Every year, one ripe, so I think Year name."

Bronze inscriptions often use " year " as the year of the year, among which "wannian yongbao" is an idiom in inscriptions.

In addition, the Western Zhou Dynasty to " Wo ", " people " for the word " in " with the word of cases, such as the North sub-goblet ︰ "north of the child at first glance (as) Zun Yi Bao, Chi-mai (million) Wo (years), grandson "Zi Yongbao" (Revision and Supplement of "Integration" 6507). Among them, "Wanhe" and " He " should be pronounced as " year ". The father of the father: "The father of the father is (as) travelled, [its] ten thousand people (years)." Fang Junyi and Yang Shuda think that " person " should be pronounced " year ". " People " for " years " with examples of state is also seen as the father of the white pot and season㚸Can jar.

In the Warring States period, the year is used as a unit of time (see He Linyi, Chen Bingxin) except for the name and original meaning of the person.

The word "nian" in the Warring States period is closely related to whether the crops are harvested or not. Xu Shen has a grasp of this point, and his statement is also very consistent with the handed down documents. "Shuowen": "This is the work. Gu Shu also. Cong He Qiansheng. "Chunqiu Zhuan" says: "Dayousi." (Press: refers to "Chunqiujing. Xuangong sixteen years")" "Dayou The meaning of "year" can be found in "The Story of the Spring and Autumn Ram. four. "The Three Years of Huan Gong": "He said, "What is the great year?" He Xiu said: "All the grains are mature." "Daiyounian" means "Dafengnian", and "Dafengnian" is The year when the grains are ripe and the harvest is great. The meaning of "Years" can be found in "The Story of Spring and Autumn Valley. "The Three Years of Huan Gong": "There are years. All the grains are ripe for years."

The ancients valued the harvest of crops, as can be seen from their prayers for good harvest. "Zhou Li. Volume 24. "Yi Zhang": "Fan Kingdom prays for the New Year in Tian Zu", Zheng Xuan's note: "Pray for the New Year, pray for the good year".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The year character oracle bone inscriptions are carved in the shape of human beings, meaning the harvest of the valley. Because the harvest is likely to be an agricultural society in the event, and the ancient cereal one crop a year, so " years " are (extended) used in anniversary.
humanum_full_description:
現在通行的楷書「年」字，從字形看，可算是純粹的「記號字」（參裘錫圭）。其較早期的字形的形符及聲符已不復見。《康熙字典》把其字歸入「干」部，看來是不得已的做法。

　　甲骨文年字形象人負禾，字作「秂」形，「人」既表義又標音（參王輝、沈培；按︰「人」、「年」同韻在某些閩南話中仍保留著）。「秂」，《玉篇．禾部》訓其義曰︰「欲結米」，《集韻．真韻》謂︰「禾欲結者」，即是禾將結實。二字書所訓正與「秂」字構形初義暗合。禾熟可收割，捆成一束，人方可負禾。故「秂」形構本義應是穀熟收成。亦可指一年中莊稼的收成，這個意思保存在後世用語如豐年（豐年即豐收之年）、年景及年成。又可能由於禾穀每年一熟，故以之作紀時之用。

　　西周以後金文字形訛變，原初所從「人」形中央或增圓點，或加橫畫成「千」形，整字作「秊」形。其形為睡虎地簡、小篆所承。金文有的在「千」形下加一畫，訛變成「𡈼」形（按︰非「壬」形，參「𡈼」）。一說古文字時增橫畫，無意︰從千乃從人所衍變，從𡈼乃從千所衍變（參李孝定）。戰國金文有字形下部所從訛作「土」。

　　小篆從禾千聲。王輝認為千字從十人聲，年為人聲之孳乳字，故可與人同音，可備一說。

　　馬王堆漢墓帛書年字寫得有點像後世的「手」形。東魏楷書有將年字作從禾從干形的（見高湛墓誌）。而形近現在通行的楷書「年」字於南朝時已見（如蕭憺碑）。

　　甲骨文用其本義。卜辭常見「受年」一語，讀作「授年」，意思是授予好收成（參陳秉新）。

　　又用作紀時名詞。古時穀一熟謂一年，卜辭︰「貞自今十年㞢(又)五」（《合集》24610），其中年即用作此意（徐中舒），表示十五年。若此例之分析可信，則《爾雅》之說可商，因為殷人很可能已有以「年」作紀時之用。《爾雅•釋天》︰「夏曰歲，商曰祀，周日年，唐虞曰載。」姑勿論《爾雅》之說可信否，郭璞之注仍可參︰「歲，取星行一次；祀，取四時一終；年，取禾一熟；載，取物終更始。」《邢昺疏》︰「年者，禾熟之名。每歲一熟，故以爲歲名。」

　　金文常用「年」作年歲之年，其中「萬年永寶」乃金文之習語。

　　另外，西周有以「禾」、「人」二字作「年」字用之例，如北子觶︰「北子乍(作)寶尊彝，其邁(萬)禾(年)，孫子子永寶」（《集成》修訂增補本6507）。其中「萬禾」，「禾」當讀作「年」。甫人父匜︰「甫人父乍(作)旅匜，[其]萬人(年)用。」方濬益、楊樹達認為其中「人」應讀作「年」。「人」作「年」用的例子亦見於成白邦父壺及季㚸朁罍。

　　戰國文字中，年字除用為人名和本義外，均作時間單位用（參何琳儀、陳秉新）。

　　戰國「年」字與農作物收成豐碩與否關係至緊，許慎對這一點有握要的理解，他的說法亦與傳世文獻十分吻合。《說文》︰「本作秊。穀熟也。从禾千聲。《春秋傳》曰：『大有秊。』（按︰指《春秋經．宣公十六年》）」「大有年」之意可參《春秋公羊傳．四．桓公三年》︰「彼其曰大有年何？大豐年也。」何休注曰︰「謂五穀皆大熟成。」「大有年」即「大豐年」，而「大豐年」即是五穀成熟、大豐收之年。「有年」之意可參《春秋穀梁傳．桓公三年》︰「有年。五穀皆熟爲有年也。」

　　古人重視農作物之收成，從他們對豐年之祈求可見一斑。《周禮．卷廿四．籥章》︰「凡國祈年于田祖」，鄭玄注︰「祈年，祈豐年也」。
humanum_short_description: 年字甲骨文刻作人負禾之形，會穀熟收成之意。很可能由於收割是農業社會年中的盛事，而且古時禾穀一年一熟，於是「年」被（引申）用作周年之年。

現在通行的楷書「 年 」字，從字形看，可算是純粹的「記號字」（參裘錫圭）。其較早期的字形的形符及聲符已不復見。《康熙字典》把其字歸入「 干 」部，看來是不得已的做法。 甲骨文年字形象人負禾，字作「 秂 」形，「 人 」既表義又標音（參王輝、沈培；按︰「 人 」、「 年 」同韻在某些閩南話中仍保留著）。「 秂 」，《玉篇．禾部》訓其義曰︰「欲結米」，《集韻．真韻》謂︰「禾欲結者」，即是禾將結實。二字書所訓正與「 秂 」字構形初義暗合。禾熟可收割，捆成一束，人方可負禾。故「 秂 」形構本義應是穀熟收成。亦可指一年中莊稼的收成，這個意思保存在後世用語如豐年（豐年即豐收之年）、年景及年成。又可能由於禾穀每年一熟，故以之作紀時之用。 西周以後金文字形訛變，原初所從「 人 」形中央或增圓點，或加橫畫成「 千 」形，整字作「 秊 」形。其形為睡虎地簡、小篆所承。金文有的在「 千 」形下加一畫，訛變成「 𡈼 」形（按︰非「 壬 」形，參「 𡈼 」）。一說古文字時增橫畫，無意︰從千乃從人所衍變，從𡈼乃從千所衍變（參李孝定）。戰國金文有字形下部所從訛作「 土 」。 小篆從禾千聲。王輝認為千字從十人聲，年為人聲之孳乳字，故可與人同音，可備一說。 馬王堆漢墓帛書年字寫得有點像後世的「 手 」形。東魏楷書有將年字作從禾從干形的（見高湛墓誌）。而形近現在通行的楷書「 年 」字於南朝時已見（如蕭憺碑）。 甲骨文用其本義。卜辭常見「受年」一語，讀作「授年」，意思是授予好收成（參陳秉新）。 又用作紀時名詞。古時穀一熟謂一年，卜辭︰「貞自今十年㞢(又)五」（《合集》24610），其中年即用作此意（徐中舒），表示十五年。若此例之分析可信，則《爾雅》之說可商，因為殷人很可能已有以「 年 」作紀時之用。《爾雅•釋天》︰「夏曰歲，商曰祀，周日年，唐虞曰載。」姑勿論《爾雅》之說可信否，郭璞之注仍可參︰「歲，取星行一次；祀，取四時一終；年，取禾一熟；載，取物終更始。」《邢昺疏》︰「年者，禾熟之名。每歲一熟，故以爲歲名。」 金文常用「 年 」作年歲之年，其中「萬年永寶」乃金文之習語。 另外，西周有以「 禾 」、「 人 」二字作「 年 」字用之例，如北子觶︰「北子乍(作)寶尊彝，其邁(萬)禾(年)，孫子子永寶」（《集成》修訂增補本6507）。其中「萬禾」，「 禾 」當讀作「 年 」。甫人父匜︰「甫人父乍(作)旅匜，[其]萬人(年)用。」方濬益、楊樹達認為其中「 人 」應讀作「 年 」。「 人 」作「 年 」用的例子亦見於成白邦父壺及季㚸朁罍。 戰國文字中，年字除用為人名和本義外，均作時間單位用（參何琳儀、陳秉新）。 戰國「 年 」字與農作物收成豐碩與否關係至緊，許慎對這一點有握要的理解，他的說法亦與傳世文獻十分吻合。《說文》︰「本作秊。穀熟也。从禾千聲。《春秋傳》曰：『大有秊。』（按︰指《春秋經．宣公十六年》）」「大有年」之意可參《春秋公羊傳．四．桓公三年》︰「彼其曰大有年何？大豐年也。」何休注曰︰「謂五穀皆大熟成。」「大有年」即「大豐年」，而「大豐年」即是五穀成熟、大豐收之年。「有年」之意可參《春秋穀梁傳．桓公三年》︰「有年。五穀皆熟爲有年也。」 古人重視農作物之收成，從他們對豐年之祈求可見一斑。《周禮．卷廿四．籥章》︰「凡國祈年于田祖」，鄭玄注︰「祈年，祈豐年也」。

"Kangxi Dictionary" classified the words into the " cadres" department, which seems to be a last resort. The character of the year in oracle bone inscriptions bears the image of human beings, and the character is made of " 秂". " 人" is both the meaning and the pronunciation (see Wang Hui, Shen Pei; press: the same rhyme of " 人" and " 年" is still used in some Minnan dialects. Reserved). " Zi", "Jade Chapter. "He Bu" instructs its meaning: "Want to knot rice", "Ji Yun. "True Rhyme" says: "He who desires to knot" means that he will be strong. The teaching of the two-character book coincides with the original meaning of the " 秂" character. The crops can be harvested and tied into a bunch before people can bear the crops. Therefore, the original meaning of " 秂" should be the ripe harvest. It can also refer to the harvest of crops in a year. This meaning is preserved in later terminology such as abundant years (the year of abundance is the year of the harvest), the year and the year. It is also possible that the grains are ripened every year, so they are used for time keeping. After the Western Zhou Dynasty, the form of the gold characters was corrupted. The original " person" shape had a dot in the center, or horizontally drawn into a " thousand" shape, and the whole character was made into a " 秊" shape. Its shape is inherited by Sleeping Tiger Dijian and Xiaozhuan. Some of the inscriptions add a picture under the " thousand" shape, and it becomes a " 𡈼" shape (click: non-" non" shape, refer to " 𡈼"). When talking about ancient characters, the horizontal painting is added, unintentionally: from Qian Nai to change from people, from 𡈼 Nai to change from Qiansuo (see Li Xiaoding). The Bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period have a copy of " earth" from the lower part of the font. Xiao Zhuan from He Qiansheng. Wang Hui believes that thousands of characters originate from ten human voices, and Nian is the word for breast milk, so it can be homophonic with other people and can be prepared. Mawangdui Han Mausoleum is written in silk characters like " hand" in later generations. In the regular script of the Eastern Wei Dynasty, there are the characters of the year from Heconggan (see Gao Zhan's epitaph). The character " Nian" in regular script that is currently popular has been seen in the Southern Dynasties (such as the Xiao Xu Monument). Oracle uses its original meaning. The term "receiving the year" is often used in inscriptions, pronounced "grant year", which means to grant a good harvest (see Chen Bingxin). It is also used as a noun of time period. In ancient times, Gu Yiming said one year, and the inscription: "Zhen from the present ten years 㞢 (also) five" ("Collection" 24610), the middle of the year is used for this meaning (Xu Zhongshu), which means fifteen years. If the analysis of this case is credible, then the "Er Ya" can be discussed, because the people of Yin probably already use " year" as a time record. "Erya·Shutian": "Xia is the year of the year, Shang is the sacred ceremony, and on Sunday, Tang Yu is the year of Zai." Don’t say whether the "Erya" is credible, Guo Pu’s note can still be found: "Sui, Take the stars and go once; for the sacrifice, take the four o'clock and one end; the year, take the crop for one ripe; load, take the thing and change the beginning." "Xing Bingshu": "The year is the name of the crop. Every year, one ripe, so I think Year name." Bronze inscriptions often use " year" as the year of the year, among which "wannian yongbao" is an idiom in inscriptions. In addition, the Western Zhou Dynasty to " Wo", " people" for the word " in" with the word of cases, such as the North sub-goblet ︰ "north of the child at first glance (as) Zun Yi Bao, Chi-mai (million) Wo (years), grandson "Zi Yongbao" (Revision and Supplement of "Integration" 6507). Among them, "Wanhe" and " He" should be pronounced as " year". The father of the father: "The father of the father is (as) travelled, [its] ten thousand people (years)." Fang Junyi and Yang Shuda think that " person" should be pronounced " year". " People" for " years" with examples of state is also seen as the father of the white pot and season㚸Can jar. In the Warring States period, the year is used as a unit of time (see He Linyi, Chen Bingxin) except for the name and original meaning of the person. The word "nian" in the Warring States period is closely related to whether the crops are harvested or not. Xu Shen has a grasp of this point, and his statement is also very consistent with the handed down documents. "Shuowen": "This is the work. Gu Shu also. Cong He Qiansheng. "The Three Years of Huan Gong": "He said, "What is the great year?" He Xiu said: "All the grains are mature." "Daiyounian" means "Dafengnian", and "Dafengnian" is The year when the grains are ripe and the harvest is great. The meaning of "Years" can be found in "The Story of Spring and Autumn Valley. "The Three Years of Huan Gong": "There are years. All the grains are ripe for years." The ancients valued the harvest of crops, as can be seen from their prayers for good harvest. "Zhou Li. 年字的基本解释

年
nián
地球绕太阳一周的时间：一年。三年五载。
每年的：年会。年鉴。年利。年薪。
一年的开始：年节。新年。
有关年节的（用品）：年画。年礼。年货。
时期，时代：近年。年华。年号（ａ．帝王用的纪年名称；ｂ．公元纪年名称）。年限。年深日久。
收成：年成。年景。年谨。荒年。
岁数：年纪。年事（岁数）。年高。年轮。
人一生所经年岁的分期：幼年。童年。青年。壮年。中年。老年。
科举时代同年考中者的互称：年兄。年谊（同年登科的关系）。
姓。
ageannualNew Yearyear

年字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nián］
［《廣韻》奴顛切，平先，泥。］
亦作“秊1”。
(1)谷熟。
(2)一年中庄稼的收成，年成。
(3)时间单位。地球绕太阳一周的时间，即太阳年，一年为365日5时48分46秒。而现行历法（阳历）规定平年三百六十五日，每四年有一个闰年，增加一日，有三百六十六日。我国古代称之为岁，初定为三百六十六日，后经实测改进为三百六十五日又四分之一，即《史记·历书》所载《历术甲子篇》的数据。参阅《史记·历书》“大餘五”司马贞索隐。
(4)指朔数。即我国的农历，平年为十二个朔望月，闰年为十三个朔望月。
(5)年节。
(6)用以指有关年节用的物品。参见“年糕”、“年貨”、“年畫”。
(7)每年的。参见“年會”、“年鑑”、“年産量”。
(8)指科举时代同年登科的关系。见“年兄”、“年伯”。
(9)年代。
(10)日期，指某一确定时间。
(11)岁月，泛指时间。
(12)指生活，生计。
(13)年纪，岁数。
(14)岁。计算年龄的单位，今皆用岁。
(15)一生中按年龄划分的阶段。

年字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【禾字部】　年； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页340第01
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【廣韻】奴顚切【集韻】【類篇】【韻會】寧顚切【正韻】寧田切，?撚平聲。【說文】本作秊。穀熟也。从禾千聲。【春秋•桓三年】有年。【穀梁傳】五穀皆熟爲有年。【宣十六年】大有年。【穀梁傳】五穀大熟爲大有年。　又歲也。【爾雅•釋天】夏曰歲，商曰祀，周日年，唐虞曰載。【註】歲取星行一次，祀取四時一終，年取禾一熟，載取物終更始。【疏】年者，禾熟之名。每歲一熟，故以爲歲名。【周禮•春官】正歲年以序事。【註】中數曰歲，朔數曰年。【疏】一年之內，有二十四氣。節氣在前，中氣在後。節氣一名朔氣。中氣帀則爲歲，朔氣帀則爲年。【左傳•宣三年】卜年七百。　又齒也。【釋名】年，進也。進而前也。【禮•王制】凡三王養老，皆引年。【註】引年，挍年也。【左傳•定四年】武王之母弟八人，周公爲太宰，康叔爲司宼，?季爲司空，五叔無官，豈尚年哉。【註】言以德爲輕重，而不以齒爲先後也。　又姓。【萬姓統譜】永樂中有年當，懷遠人，歷官戸部尚書。　又叶禰因切，音紉。【前漢•敘傳】封禪

年字的源字形

年字的起名意思

：指时期、时代、岁数、太阳一周的时间。

year
Basic explanation of words
year
nián
The time for the earth to circle the sun: one year. Three years and five years.
Annual: Annual meeting. Yearbook. annual interest. Annual salary.
The beginning of the year: New Year's Day. new Year.
(Articles) related to the New Year: New Year pictures. New year ceremony. New Year's goods.
Period, era: recent years. years. Year number (a. The name of the chronology used by the emperor; b. The name of the AD chronology). Years. Years go by.
Harvest: mature. Year view. Years sincerely. Famine year.
Age: age. Age (years). Years high. Annual ring.
The staging of years in a person's life: childhood. childhood. youth. Prime of life. middle aged. elderly.
In the imperial examination era, the names of those who passed the exams in the same year were: Brother Nian. Nianyi (Relationship with the Dengke in the same year).
name.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [nián]
["Guangyun" Slave cut, flat first, mud. ]
Also known as "秊1".
(1) Grain cooked.
(2) The harvest of crops in a year, matured.
(3) Time unit. The time that the earth revolves around the sun, the solar year, is 5:48:46 on 365 days. The current calendar (Gregorian calendar) stipulates that there are three hundred and sixty-five days in a normal year, and there is a leap year every four years, with an additional day of three hundred and sixty-six days. In ancient my country, it was called "year". It was initially set at 366 days, and after actual measurement, it was improved to 365 days and a quarter, which is the data of "Lishu Jiazi Pian" contained in "Historical Records·Almanac". . See "Historical Records·Almanac" "Dayu Fifth" Sima Zhensuoyin.
(4) Refers to the new number. In my country's lunar calendar, there are twelve synodic months in normal years, and thirteen synodic months in leap years.
(5) New Year's Day.
(6) It is used to refer to the items used in the relevant year. See "nian gao", "new year goods", "new year pictures".
(7) Annually. See "Annual Meeting", "Yearbook", "Annual Output".
(8) Refers to the relationship between the imperial examinations in the same year. See "Brother Nian", "Bo Nian".
(9) Years.
(10) Date refers to a certain time.
(11) Years, generally refers to time.
(12) Refers to life, livelihood.
(13) Age and number of years.
(14) years old. The unit for calculating age is all ages today.
(15) The stages in life divided by age.

年年
год
Первоначальное значение - «урожай».
«Саид Вэнь»: «Нянь, Гу Дун (горячий) тоже».
Надписи на костях оракула часто содержат такие слова, как «Год Шоу Тай» и «Год Шоу Райса».
«Весна и осень» также имеет предложение «Да Ю Нянь».
Глиф представляет собой сцену, когда человек возвращается домой со зрелым урожаем.
*
Каждый год
nián
I сущ.
1) год (как календарная единица); годичный; ежегодный
去年 прошлый год
每年 каждый год

年视差 годичный параллакс

学年 учебный год
年平均气温 среднегодовая температура

少(老)年 shào(lǎo)nián юные (преклонные, старческие лета) годы (лета)
4) Новый год, новогодний
过年 встречать Новый Год
拜年 поздравить с Новым годом
5)* урожайный год, урожай
大有年 был прекрасный урожай

Мнемоника

  • Искажено. Элементы злак 禾 и тысяча 千 в значении «богатый урожай, которым завершается с/х год».

  • "Уйдёт целый год, прежде чем собрать урожай риса."

秊

Radicals: 牛  (cow, gun)
Meaning Mnemonic
The cow part of this kanji is slightly altered, but I think you can see where it is. The gun looks just fine, though. Think back to a fake memory you have living on the farm. You have your gun, and you gotta use it on a cow (ruh roh). Once a year on New Year's, you have to go out and shoot one of the cows. It's only a yearly shooting, though, so at least there's that respite.
You'll have to imagine yourself doing this to remember the meaning of the kanji. Focus on the thought that "okay... it's only once a year... I only have to do this once a year..."
Reading Mnemonic
It is New Years, though, so when you bring the dead cow back home, it’s time to celebrate. Using the cow’s organs and bones, you and your siblings construct a nendoroid (ねん). Nendoroids are Japanese toys - little plastic figurines (Google it if need be). You make a little cow nendoroid holding a gun. How cute.
How funny that you use dead cow parts to make a miniature cow holding a gun much like the one you murdered earlier. Imagine yourself playing with this nendoroid as you think about how weird it was to make a cow nendoroid out of a dead cow.

Examples: 年 (とし)
一 (один), ノ, 干 (сухой)
